00023 //Error codes.
00024 //TODO: Make them more comprehensive based on status code from NXT.
00025 //       Also provide a method to translate numeric error code to more
00026 //       user friendly error string.
00027 
00028 enum ErrorCode
00029 {               
00030         UnsupportedType = -1,
00031         IteratorFailed = -2,
00032         InvalidFileIterator = -3,
00033         IteratorAdvanceFailed = -4,
00034         InvalidFileHandler = -5,
00035         FileOpenFailed = -6,            
00036         WriteNotEnabled = -7,
00037         FileNotOpen = -8,               
00038         ReadFailed = -9,
00039         WriteFailed = -10,
00040         FileCloseFailed = -11,          
00041         WriteBufferIllegalSize = -12,
00042 };

00045 struct NXTFile
00046 {
00048         NXTFile() : file(NULL) , name(NULL)
00049         {
00050                 size = 0;
00051                 asize = 0;
00052                 isOpen = false;
00053                 isWriteable = false;
00054         }
00055 
00057         NXTFile(nFANTOM100::iFile* f): name((char*) malloc(20))
00058         {
00059       file = f;
00060 
00061           if (f == NULL) return;
00062 
00063           f->getName(name);
00064 
00065           nFANTOM100::tStatus status;
00066 
00067           size = f->getSize(status);
00068           asize = f->getAvailableSize(status);
00069 
00070           if (status.isFatal())
00071                   size = -1;
00072 
00073           isOpen = false;
00074           isWriteable =false;
00075         }
00076 
00078         char * name;
00080         int size;
00082         int asize;
00084         int mode;
00085 
00087         bool isOpen;
00089         bool isWriteable;
00090 
00091         //Won't be use in case of linux
00093         nFANTOM100::iFile* file; 
00094         bool isValid(); 
00095         int open(int mode, int size=100);
00096         int remove();
00097         int read(char* buff, int size);
00098         int write(char* buff, int size);
00099         int close();
00100 };
